# Space Law: Crime Listing Crimes are organized by their Degree (severity) as well as by color, or the letter code they are assigned.
[bold]Crimes that share the same color or code cannot be charged together.[/bold] For example, if you arrest someone for murder, you may not charge that same person for assault.

## Infractions - Typically handled with confiscation and monetary compensation.
Offense
Description
Suggested Punishment
Superficial Vandalism
To deface the station or property of another individual.
Forced repair of defaced property, or 15-40 thousand speso fine.
Drug Possession
The possession of illegal drugs in quantities appropriate for personal use.
Confiscation of illegal drugs and 25-40 thousand speso fine.
Disorderly Conduct
To conduct oneself in a way unsuitable for the retention of one’s position.
Brig until compliant and 25-45 thousand speso fine.
Creating a Hazard
To create a situation that may lead to the harm of others during normal operation in that department.
Forced removal of the situation and 15-40 thousand speso fine.
Disruptive Comms
To knowingly disrupt or needlessly populate a radio frequency with the intent to be a nuisance to users of that frequency.
Brig until compliant, and 5-35 thousand speso fine.
## Minor Crimes - These crimes tend to result in brig sentencing.
Offense
Description
Suggested Punishment
Assault
To use physical force against someone without the apparent intent to kill them.
Restraining and separation of individuals. Charges if necessary. Brig sentence of 5-10 minutes.
Pickpocketing
To steal items from another person.
Return of object(s) and brig sentence of 5-10 minutes.
Minor Vandalism
To damage, destroy, or permanently deface non-critical furniture, vendors, or personal property.
Work duty to repair damage. Brig time should vary depending on the damage and repairs done.
Vigitlantism
To perform the responsibilities and duties of the security department without approval or due cause to act.
10-15 minutes brig time.
Illegal Distribution
The possession of dangerous or illegal drugs/equipment in a quantity greater than that which is reasonable for personal consumption.
A fair brig timer decided by Warden or HoS that corresponds to the substance, amount, production, and any permanent effects on individuals.
Disturbing The Peace
To knowingly organize a movement that disrupts the normal operations of a department
Warning to disperse. Up to 15 minutes of brig time, depending on how easily the illegal protest is dispersed.
Criminal Negligence
To be negligent in one’s duty to an extent that it may cause harm, illness, or other negative effects to another. This includes the reckless operation of a shuttle.
5-10 minutes.
Trespassing
To be in an area which a person has either not purposefully been admitted to, does not have access, or has been asked to leave by someone who has access to that area.
Trespassers who leave peacefully without causing damage or theft may be released; however, those who resist should be sentenced to at least 5 minutes. Long-term trespassers who resist may get additional time reflective of their time spent in the department.
Breaking and Entering
To trespass into an area using a method of forcible entry.
Damage caused in entry should be reflected in brig timers varying from 5-15 minutes.
Discriminatory Language
To use language that demeans, generalizes, or otherwise de-personifies the individual to whom it is targeted.
10-20 minutes brigged.
Fine Evasion
To purposefully avoid or refuse to pay a legal fine.
A reasonable time and notification should be given to the plaintiff. If they blatantly oppose the fine or simply ignore after multiple warnings, for every 1 thousand Spesos 15 second timer shall be applied. For example, a 30 thousand speso fine should have a 7 and a half minute timer.
## Misdemeanors - Fines and brig time are both common punishments for these offenses.
Offense
Description
Suggested Punishment
Aggravated Assault
To take physical action against a person with the intent to grievously harm, but not to kill.
Brig time decided by HoS or Warden, depending on the severity of injuries sustained by the victim. Flat 25k fine suggested heavily.
Theft
To steal equipment or items from a workplace, or items of extraordinary value from one’s person.
Return of items, 5-15 minute brig time, 20-40k fine.
Vandalism, Major
To destroy or damage non-critical furniture, vendors, or personal property in a manner that can not be repaired.
Replacement of item(s), monetary recompensation for damage amount, 10-15 minute brig time.
Conspiracy
To knowingly work with another person in the interest of committing an illegal action.
Conspiracy can be anything from opening a door for a cartel member to fabricating weapons for them. The timer should be reflexive in the range of 10-15 minutes.
Hostile Agent
To knowingly act as a recruiter, representative, messenger, ally, benefactor, or other associate of a hostile organization as defined within Code 405.
10-20 minutes of Brig time, 25-35k fine.
Possession, Contraband Equipment
Any and all grade 2 contraband. Applied regardless of whether it was used in a crime or not.
10-15 minute brig time, 25-40k fine, confiscation of contraband items.
Rioting
To act as a member in a group that collectively commits acts of major vandalism, sabotage, grand sabotage, or other felony crimes.
Decided on HoS or Warden’s judgement, as all riots can be different.
Gross Criminal Negligence
To be negligent in one’s duty to an extent that it may cause harm to multiple individuals, a department, or in a manner that directly leads to a serious injury of another person, which requires emergency medical treatment.
Time brigged depends on the severity of harm from negligence. Baseline 25 minutes in brig is encouraged, 45k flat speso fine is encouraged heavily.
Trespass, Inherently Dangerous Areas
Trespassing in an area that may lead to the injury of oneself or others. This also includes NFZs.
Removal from area, 15-minute brig time, 25k speso fine. Those who resist severely should, like 109, receive additional time reflective of their time in the secure area. If used for NFZ violation, use half of the time they were in the NFZ for additional time.
Breaking and Entering, Inherently Dangerous Areas
To trespass into an area which may lead to the injury of oneself or others using forcible entry.
Removal from the area, 15-minute brig time, potentially increased depending on damage caused upon entry. 30k speso fine.
Insubordination
To knowingly disobey a lawful order from a superior without good reason.
10-15 minutes brigged, Possible Demotion, 25-35k fine.
Fraid
To misrepresent one's intention in the interest of gaining property or money from another individual.
10-20 minutes brigged, return of property or money to the victim, 45-60k fine.
Mutilation
To purposefully modify an individual without consent, or with the intent to harm.
Reverse of operations, 15-20 minutes on brig time minimum.
False Imprisonment
To unlawfully confine a person against their will within a location they are normally present in.
15-20 minute brigged, 20-45k fine.
## Felonies - Particularly violent offenders may be placed in permanent confinement.
Offense
Description
Suggested Punishment
Murder
To purposefully kill someone.
20-40 minutes brigged, 40-60k speso fine
Larceny
To steal rare, expensive (Items of greater than 50,000 speso value), or restricted equipment from secure areas or one’s person.
25-35 minutes brigged, return of items, 40-50k speso fine.
Sabotage
To destroy station assets or resources critical to normal or emergency station procedures, or cause sections of the station to become uninhabitable.
35-45 minutes brigged, 40-60k speso fine.
Grand Conspiracy
To knowingly work with another person in the interest of committing a major or greater crime.
Punished the same punishment as the primary charge.
Hostile Activity
To knowingly commit an act which is in direct opposition to the interests of Colonial Command, Or to directly assist a known enemy of the Government.
20-30 minutes brigged, 35-45k speso fine.
Possession, Illegal Inherently Dangerous Equipment
To possess restricted or illegal equipment that has a primary purpose of causing harm to others, or large amounts of destruction. C3 Equipment is also included under this charge.
Removal of item(s), 20-30 minutes brigged, 40-55k speso fine.
Incitement of a Riot
To perform actions in the interest of causing large amounts of unrest up to and including rioting.
25-35 minutes brigged, 45-60k speso fine.
Manslaughter
To unintentionally kill someone through negligent, but not malicious, actions.
25-35 Minutes brigged, 35-50k speso fine, payment of victim’s medical bills.
Trespass, High Security Areas
Trespassing in any of the following without appropriate permission or access: Command areas, Personal offices, Weapons storage, weapon production, explosive storage, explosive production, or other high security areas.
30-40 minutes brigged, return of any item(s) taken, 45-60k speso fine.
Breaking and Entering, High Security Areas
To commit trespassing into a secure area as defined in Code 309 using forcible entry.
Similar to 309. However, an additional 10k speso fine is suggested.
Dereliction
To willfully abandon an obligation that is critical to the station’s continued operation.
Demotion, 40-50k speso fine.
Embezzlement
Embezzling funds from the station fund computers.
Return of funds, 40-75k fine, demotion, 20-30 minutes brigged.
Identity Theft
To assume the identity of another individual.
Removal of items used to impersonate, 40-50k speso fine, 25-35 minutes brigged.
Sexual Harassment
Non-consensual harassment that is sexual in nature. (If reported and is a OOC consent violation as well, AHELP please as this is an OOC rule break)
20-35 minutes brigged, 50-80k fine.
Illegal Mindbreaking
Permanent removal of a psion's abilities and/or latency not carried out as a punishment for a crime, by a Mantis in the line of their duties, or during an extenuating emergency situation requiring the immediate removal of the psion's powers.
220-35 minutes brigged, 85-120k fine, Returning of psion’s powers if able,Removal of perpetrator’s powers if applicable.
Kidnapping
To unlawfully abduct a person to a new location and confine a person against their will.
25-30 minutes brigged, 70-100k fine.
## Capital Crimes - Crimes for which the most extreme punishments are served.
Offense
Description
Suggested Punishment
Capital Murder
To commit the act of murder, with clear intent to kill, and to have materially taken steps to prevent the revival of the victim, or performing Decorperalization without consent or authorization from station command.
Execution, Permanent Confinement, or Decorperalization.
Grand Sabotage
To destroy or modify station assets or equipment, without which the station may collapse or otherwise become uninhabitable.
Permanent confinement, Demotion.
Espionage
To knowingly betray critical information to enemies of the station.
Execution, Prisoner transport to Colcom, Permanent confinement.
Enemy of the Government
To be a member of any of the following organizations: Hostile boarding parties, Changeling Hiveminds, cults, Dirizher Cartel.
Permanent confinement or transportation to Colonial Command for Interrogation.
Subversion of the Chain of Command
Disrupting the chain of command via either the murder of a commanding officer or illegally declaring oneself to be a commanding officer.
Permanent confinement.
Biological Terror
To knowingly release, cause, or otherwise cause the station to become affected by a disease, plant, or other biological form which may spread uncontained and or cause serious physical harm.
Permanent confinement, Execution, or decorperalization.
Sexual Assault
To non-consentually engage in sexual relations with a person. (If this is an OOC consent violation as well, AHELP if this occurs at all, as this is a rule break and is to be handled OOCly)
Execution, Transport to ColCom
Grand Kidnapping
To unlawfully abduct and confine a Command member or higher authority against their will.
Permanent confinement.
